PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("US flagged vessel attack Gulf of Aden July 2024 Maersk")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/): 
Content: "[![Current weather Vancouver, WA](<Base64-Image-Removed>)](https://www.columbian.com/weather/)

[Today's Paper](https://epaper.columbian.com)
 [Donate](https://www.columbian.com/cfj/)

[Newsletters](https://www.columbian.com/newsletters/)
 Login/Register [Subscribe](/subscribe/)

Friday,  August 29 , 2025

[![Current weather Vancouver, WA](<Base64-Image-Removed>)](https://www.columbian.com/weather/)

To search stories before 2011, [click here](https://columbian.newspapers.com)
 to access our archives.

×

![Facebook](https://www.columbian.com/wp-content/themes/columbian2/static/img/icons/social/facebook-white.svg) ![X (formerly Twitter)](https://www.columbian.com/wp-content/themes/columbian2/static/img/icons/social/x-white.svg) ![Linkedin](https://www.columbian.com/wp-content/themes/columbian2/static/img/icons/social/linkedin-white.svg) ![Pinterest](https://www.columbian.com/wp-content/themes/columbian2/static/img/icons/social/pinterest-white.svg) ![email icon](https://www.columbian.com/wp-content/themes/columbian2/static/img/icons/mail-white.svg)

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Yemen’s Houthi rebels targeted United States-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday, officials said, the latest assault by the group on the crucial maritime trade route.

The captain of the ship reported an explosion in close proximity to the vessel off the coast of Nishtun, Yemen, close to the country’s border with Oman, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said. Navy, identified the ship as the Maersk Sentosa.

The explosion took place in the farthest reaches of the waterway earlier targeted by the rebels, the center said.

It did not elaborate on what caused the explosion, though the Houthis have been known to use drones and missiles as well as bomb-carrying drone boats.

Late Tuesday night, the Houthis issued a broad claim of responsibility for three attacks, which included the Maersk Sentosa. Yahya Saree said the group was responsible for two attacks on ships in the Red Sea, but it wasn’t immediately clear which ship was the one reported by the information center.

The Houthis also said they used a drone boat in a June 27 attack on a Malta-flagged bulk carrier, Seajoy.

Meanwhile on Tuesday, the office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights expressed concern over 13 U.N. Since the latest assault, shipping or military authorities have not acknowledged any additional attacks in the region.

The last reported Houthi attack in the region took place June 28.

The rebels have targeted more than 70 vessels by firing missiles and drones in their campaign that has killed a total of four sailors. They seized one vessel and sank two since November.

In June, the number of Houthi attacks on merchant vessels increased to levels not seen since December, according to the JMIC. However, many of the ships attacked have little or no connection to the Israel-Hamas war — including some bound for Iran.

On June 28, five missiles landed near a Liberian-flagged tanker, Delinox, as it traveled off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, according to the JMIC. U.S.-led airstrikes have targeted the Houthis since January, with a series of strikes on May 30 killing at least 16 people and wounding 42 others, the rebels say.

The Houthis maintain that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or Britain as part of rebel support for the militant group Hamas in its war against Israel in the Gaza Strip. We continue to be refused access to them,” the office said in a statement.

Of the 13 employees, the U.N. Central Command issued a statement that its forces destroyed an uncrewed Houthi aerial vehicle in a Houthi-controlled area of Yemen.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/): 
Content: "The vessel and all crew are safe, and the ship is proceeding to its next port of call.

> UKMTO WARNING  
> INCIDENT 097 – ATTACK – UPDATE 001[https://t.co/fX3hWupi7g](https://t.co/fX3hWupi7g)
> [#MaritimeSecurity](https://twitter.com/hashtag/MaritimeSecurity?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
>  [#MarSec](https://twitter.com/hashtag/MarSec?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
>  [pic.twitter.com/WU1qertO4M](https://t.co/WU1qertO4M)
> 
> — UKMTO Ops Centre (@UK\_MTO) [July 9, 2024](https://twitter.com/UK_MTO/status/1810578854798315716?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Maersk confirmed details of the incident in a statement to gCaptain, noting that the vessel _Maersk Sentosa_ was targeted by a “flying object” in the “northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden” in the early hours of July 9th. A containership operated by Maersk’s U.S.-flagged shipping arm reported an attack in the eastern Gulf of Aden as the Iranian-backed Houthis continue to attack ships over the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) office said it received a report of an incident 180 nautical miles east of Nishtun, Yemen. The _Maersk Sentosa_ is operated by Maersk Line, Limited, a subsidiary of Maersk that operates US-flagged vessels.

AIS data from [MarineTraffic.com](http://marinetraffic.com/)
 shows the _Maersk Sentosa_ is underway from Algeciras, Spain to Salalah, Oman.

This incident marks the first attack against a merchant ship reported by the UKMTO office since June 28th. and European naval forces have reported incidents involving unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and unmanned surface vessels (USVs) in the Gulf of Aden and the Red Sea this month.

It is important to note that this latest incident occurred far outside the Houthis’ traditional threat area near the Bab-el-Mandeb Strait, where most Houthi attacks have been focused. The Houthis later claimed that the first use of a “locally made hypersonic missile” was used in the attack.

> Location of Monday's missile attack on the Liberian-flagged containership MSC Sarah V, now confirmed by the Joint Maritime Information Center [pic.twitter.com/04XxVmoH3j](https://t.co/04XxVmoH3j)
> 
> — Mike Schuler (@MikeSchuler) [June 24, 2024](https://twitter.com/MikeSchuler/status/1805367127886774396?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Since mid-November, the Iranian-backed Houthis have launched more than 80 attacks against merchant ships from Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels): 
Content: "The missile was intercepted before it could cause damage.[\[42\]](#cite_note-TradeWinds2-42)
 The following day, the Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack on the Yorktown and announced that they targeted the vessels _MSC Gina_ and _MSC Darwin_, which they claimed were Israeli, and a US destroyer in the Gulf of Aden.[\[43\]](#cite_note-timesofisrael20240410-43)

On 24 April, _Maersk Yorktown_ was again[\[42\]](#cite_note-TradeWinds2-42)
 targeted while underway the Gulf of Aden, along with the [Madeira](/wiki/Madeira "Madeira")
\-flagged, Swiss-owned _MSC Veracruz_. The ship's medical professionals provided vital medical attention to the injured crew members.[\[139\]](#cite_note-139)
[\[140\]](#cite_note-140)

On 8 March, the Houthis launched a large attack on US warships and commercial shipping, firing two anti-ship missiles at the Singapore-flagged bulk carrier MV _Propel Fortune_ and 37 drones at American naval vessels.[\[37\]](#cite_note-voanews20240309-37)
 A French warship and fighter jets shot down four drones approaching vessels belonging to Operation Aspides; the Danish frigate _Iver Huitfeldt_ shot down another four; and the US Navy intercepted another 15.[\[141\]](#cite_note-141)
[\[142\]](#cite_note-142)

On 14 March, reports that missiles had struck the Panama-flagged _Pacific 01_ in the Gulf of Aden were debunked.[\[143\]](#cite_note-143)
[\[144\]](#cite_note-144)
 The following day, Houthis threatened to expand attacks to include Israel-linked vessels passing through the Indian Ocean towards the Cape of Good Hope.[\[145\]](#cite_note-145)
 On the same day, Yahya Saree claimed that Houthi forces launched drones and anti-ship missiles at American and Israeli vessels in the Indian Ocean, while also targeting US naval vessels with drones.[\[146\]](#cite_note-146)

On 24 March, Houthis targeted the Chinese-owned and Panama-flagged oil tanker MV _Huang Pu_ with six anti-ship ballistic missiles as she was en route to [New Mangalore Port](/wiki/New_Mangalore_Port "New Mangalore Port")
, India.[\[38\]](#cite_note-reuters20240324-38)
 One of the missiles landed in Yemen, while four others struck in the vicinity of the vessel and the fifth directly struck her, causing a fire which was extinguished thirty minutes later. They identified the commercial vessels as the British-owned, Marshall Islands-flagged _Hope Island_ and the Israeli-owned, Panama-flagged _MSC Grace F_ and _MSC Gina_.[\[41\]](#cite_note-arab.news-20240407-41)
[\[40\]](#cite_note-The_Times_of_Israel-20240407-40)
[\[39\]](#cite_note-Swan-39)

On 9 April, the _Maersk Yorktown_, a US-flagged and owned container ship which was being escorted by the destroyers [USS _Mason_](/wiki/USS_Mason_(DDG-87) "USS Mason (DDG-87)")
 and [USS _Laboon_](/wiki/USS_Laboon "USS Laboon")
 at the time, was targeted by an anti-ship missile while traversing the Gulf of Aden. Marine war insurance agency Vessel Protect stated that the Houthis had carried out ten strikes in June and five in May.[\[166\]](#cite_note-reuters20240621-166)

The Houthis targeted a commercial ship in the Gulf of Aden on 21 June according to the UKMTO center said and the Joint Maritime Information Cente, with no casualties or damage being reported.[\[64\]](#cite_note-Roosevelt-64)
 The Houthis on the next day identified it as the Liberian-flagged bulk carrier _Transworld Navigator_ and stated that they had targeted it with ballistic missiles.[\[63\]](#cite_note-Transworld-63)
 They also claimed to have targeted the _Shorthorn Express_ in the Mediterranean Sea, but there was no independent confirmation of the attack.[\[167\]](#cite_note-167)

The Houthis targeted the _Transworld Navigator_ again on 23 June using a USV in the Red Sea, with the crew reporting minor injuries and moderate damage to the ship. The group stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation foe the [Israeli attack](/wiki/13_July_2024_Al-Mawasi_airstrikes "13 July 2024 Al-Mawasi airstrikes")
 on [Al-Mawasi](/wiki/Al-Mawasi "Al-Mawasi")
 on 13 July.[\[76\]](#cite_note-15July1-76)
[\[75\]](#cite_note-15July2-75)
[\[177\]](#cite_note-177)

The Singapore-flagged container ship _Lobivia_ was reported to have been struck while transiting through the Gulf of Aden on 19 July, causing a fire onboard which was extinguished by its crew who were reported to be safe. [US Central Command](/wiki/United_States_Central_Command "United States Central Command")
 responded that the Houthis attacks "have nothing to do with the conflict in Gaza" and that Houthis had "fired indiscriminately into the Red Sea", targeting ships, and impacting more than 40 nations.[\[7\]](#cite_note-bbc-20240126-7)
[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
 On 3 May 2024, the Houthi-aligned Yemeni Armed Forces [SPC](/wiki/Supreme_Political_Council "Supreme Political Council")
 military spokesperson [Yahya Saree](/wiki/Yahya_Saree "Yahya Saree")
 announced, in a televised speech, that "We will target any ships heading to Israeli ports in the Mediterranean Sea in any area we are able to reach".[\[9\]](#cite_note-AlJ20240503-9)

### First and second phases (November – December 2023)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Car_carrier_Galaxy_Leader.jpg/250px-Car_carrier_Galaxy_Leader.jpg)](/wiki/File:Car_carrier_Galaxy_Leader.jpg)

_[Galaxy Leader](/wiki/Galaxy_Leader "Galaxy Leader")
_ at Bremerhaven, 2006. The Greek-owned and Malta-flagged vessel, which came from Vietnam and was en route to Israel, was able to continue transiting the Red Sea.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Reuters20240116-23)
[\[123\]](#cite_note-123)

On 17 January, Houthis struck the US-owned bulk carrier MV _Genco Picardy_ with a drone while it traversed the Gulf of Aden, causing minimal damage and no injuries to the crew.[\[24\]](#cite_note-Livingstone20240117-24)
[\[124\]](#cite_note-124)
 The Indian Navy announced the following day that [INS _Visakhapatnam_](/wiki/INS_Visakhapatnam "INS Visakhapatnam")
 was diverted to rescue the ship's crew of 22 people. Following the incident, the two vessels were ordered back to the [Gulf of Aden](/wiki/Gulf_of_Aden "Gulf of Aden")
 by US Navy instruction with Navy escort and [Maersk Line Limited](/wiki/Maersk_Line_Limited "Maersk Line Limited")
, a subsidiary that sails primarily US government-owned goods, suspended all sailings in the Red Sea.[\[27\]](#cite_note-lli-20240124-27)
[\[127\]](#cite_note-marex-20240124-127)
[\[128\]](#cite_note-128)

On 26 January, a Houthi ballistic missile fired toward USS _Carney_ was shot down.[\[129\]](#cite_note-129)
 The same day, the [_Marlin Luanda_](/wiki/Marlin_Luanda_missile_strike "Marlin Luanda missile strike")
, an oil tanker operated by British company Oceonix Services on behalf of [Trafigura](/wiki/Trafigura "Trafigura")
, carrying Russian-produced [naphtha](/wiki/Naphtha "Naphtha")
, was hit by a missile as it traversed the Gulf of Aden 60 nautical miles (110 km; 69 mi) southeast of Aden, according to UK Maritime Trade Operations. Ambrey reported that a Barbados-flagged British ship received minor damage to its port 57 nautical miles (106 km; 66 mi) from the coast of Hodeidah, and the UKMTO said that it also received reports that the port side of a ship was struck by a projectile west of Hodeidah and a small craft was seen nearby.[\[29\]](#cite_note-theguardian20240206-29)
 The second ship, which the UKMTO identified as a Marshall Islands-flagged, Greek-owned vessel originating from the US and en route to India, was attacked off the coast of Aden. Later the ship continued towards her next destination.[\[152\]](#cite_note-152)
[\[153\]](#cite_note-153)
 Another missile landed in close proximity to the nearby Antigua and Barbuda-flagged MV _Maisha_, causing no damage.[\[154\]](#cite_note-154)

On 29 April, Houthis attacked the Malta-flagged merchant vessel MV _Cyclades_ with anti-ship missiles and UAVs, causing minor damage.[\[45\]](#cite_note-apnews20240429-45)
 The Houthis also claimed responsibility for a drone attack on the Portugal-flagged _MSC Orion_ that day, directly striking her around 600 kilometres (370 mi) off the coast of Yemen while she was in the Arabian Sea, making it the furthest attack by the Houthis so far.[\[46\]](#cite_note-apnews20240430-46)
[\[155\]](#cite_note-155)
 In response to the increased range, the EU's [Operation Atalanta](/wiki/Operation_Atalanta "Operation Atalanta")
 advised for an alternative shipping route to be established at least 150 nautical miles (280 km; 170 mi) east of the current route.[\[156\]](#cite_note-156)

### Fourth phase (May – July 2024)

In early May 2024, in what he described as the "fourth stage" of the attacks, Houthi leader Abdul Malik al-Houthi vowed to attack ships of any company related to Israel or carrying goods for Israel in response to Israel's [Rafah offensive](/wiki/Rafah_offensive "Rafah offensive")
 in southern Gaza.[\[157\]](#cite_note-157)

On 9 May, the Houthis claimed responsibility for attacks on three Panama-flagged container ships."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Wikipedia mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.

_________________________



SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "A US-flagged vessel has been attacked in the Guld of Aden in July 2024. A Spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk said: 'There was an attack targeted on one of the company's US-flagged vessels at the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("US flagged vessel attack Gulf of Aden July 2024 Maersk")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/): 
Content: The Columbian reports that Yemen’s Houthi rebels targeted a United States-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday. The British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center identified the ship as the Maersk Sentosa. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The article is dated August 29, 2025.


From [Source](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/): 
Content: The search result from gCaptain.com reports that the U.S.-flagged vessel _Maersk Sentosa_ was targeted by a "flying object" in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024. The vessel and crew are safe, and the ship is proceeding to its next port of call. The attack occurred in the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden. The article also mentions that the Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. <image:8322>, <image:8323>.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels): 
Content: The search result from Wikipedia mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
A U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024, by a "flying object" in the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden according to [gCaptain.com](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/). The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The crew and vessel are safe.

Another article from [The Columbian](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/) mentions that the attack was on a U.S.-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday. The article is dated August 29, 2025. Additionally, [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels) mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "A US-flagged vessel has been attacked in the Guld of Aden in July 2024. A Spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk said: 'There was an attack targeted on one of the company's US-flagged vessels at the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("US flagged vessel attack Gulf of Aden July 2024 Maersk")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
A U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024, by a "flying object" in the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden according to [gCaptain.com](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/). The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The crew and vessel are safe.

Another article from [The Columbian](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/) mentions that the attack was on a U.S.-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday. The article is dated August 29, 2025. Additionally, [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels) mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that a U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The evidence also mentions an attack on the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ on April 9, 2024.

The provided evidence does not include a statement from a spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk.

The claim is partially verified. The attack on a US-flagged vessel in the Gulf of Aden in July 2024 is confirmed. However, the statement from Maersk's spokesperson cannot be verified with the provided evidence.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "A US-flagged vessel has been attacked in the Guld of Aden in July 2024. A Spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk said: 'There was an attack targeted on one of the company's US-flagged vessels at the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("US flagged vessel attack Gulf of Aden July 2024 Maersk")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
A U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024, by a "flying object" in the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden according to [gCaptain.com](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/). The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The crew and vessel are safe.

Another article from [The Columbian](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/) mentions that the attack was on a U.S.-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday. The article is dated August 29, 2025. Additionally, [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels) mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that a U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The evidence also mentions an attack on the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ on April 9, 2024.

The provided evidence does not include a statement from a spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk.

The claim is partially verified. The attack on a US-flagged vessel in the Gulf of Aden in July 2024 is confirmed. However, the statement from Maersk's spokesperson cannot be verified with the provided evidence.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is partially accurate. A U.S.-flagged vessel was attacked in the Gulf of Aden in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not verify the statement from a Maersk spokesperson.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "A US-flagged vessel has been attacked in the Guld of Aden in July 2024. A Spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk said: 'There was an attack targeted on one of the company's US-flagged vessels at the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("US flagged vessel attack Gulf of Aden July 2024 Maersk")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
A U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024, by a "flying object" in the northernmost part of the Gulf of Aden according to [gCaptain.com](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/). The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The crew and vessel are safe.

Another article from [The Columbian](https://www.columbian.com/news/2024/jul/10/yemens-houthi-rebels-target-a-us-flagged-container-ship-in-the-gulf-of-aden/) mentions that the attack was on a U.S.-flagged container ship in the Gulf of Aden on Tuesday. The article is dated August 29, 2025. Additionally, [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houthi_attacks_on_commercial_vessels) mentions that on April 9, 2024, the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ was targeted by an anti-ship missile in the Gulf of Aden.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that a U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was targeted in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The evidence also mentions an attack on the US-flagged container ship _Maersk Yorktown_ on April 9, 2024.

The provided evidence does not include a statement from a spokesperson at Denmark's shipping company Maersk.

The claim is partially verified. The attack on a US-flagged vessel in the Gulf of Aden in July 2024 is confirmed. However, the statement from Maersk's spokesperson cannot be verified with the provided evidence.


## Final Judgement
The claim is partially accurate. A U.S.-flagged vessel was attacked in the Gulf of Aden in July 2024. However, the provided evidence does not verify the statement from a Maersk spokesperson.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
A U.S.-flagged container ship, the Maersk Sentosa, was attacked in the Gulf of Aden on July 9, 2024, as reported by [gCaptain.com](https://gcaptain.com/u-s-flagged-containership-targeted-by-flying-object-in-gulf-of-aden/). While the attack is confirmed, the claim's assertion about a Maersk spokesperson's statement cannot be verified with the provided evidence.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

```

```

# Search Result

Content: "Vance")
**_.

*   [Appearances](https://www.c-span.org/person/?105171)
     on [C-SPAN](/wiki/C-SPAN "C-SPAN")

     at the _[Biographical Directory of the United States Congress](/wiki/Biographical_Directory_of_the_United_States_Congress "Biographical Directory of the United States Congress")
    _
*   [Financial information (federal office)](https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/C00783142)
     at the [Federal Election Commission](/wiki/Federal_Election_Commission "Federal Election Commission")
    
*   [Legislation sponsored](https://www.congress.gov/member/j-vance/V000137)
     at the [Library of Congress](/wiki/Library_of_Congress "Library of Congress")
    
*   [Profile](https://justfacts.votesmart.org/candidate/201794)
     at [Vote Smart](/wiki/Vote_Smart "Vote Smart")
    
*   [Campaign website](https://jdvance.com/)
    
*   [JD Vance](https://www.opensecrets.org/personal-finances/net-worth?cid=N00048832)
     on [OpenSecrets](/wiki/OpenSecrets "OpenSecrets")
    , a website that tracks and publishes data on campaign finance and lobbying [![Edit this at Wikidata](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png)](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q28935729#P2686 "Edit this at Wikidata")
    
*   [JD Vance](https://www.LittleSis.org/person/252515)
     on [LittleSis](/wiki/LittleSis "LittleSis")
    , a website that publishes data on who-knows-who between government, donors and business [![Edit this at Wikidata](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png)](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q28935729#P3398 "Edit this at Wikidata")
    
*   [J.D. [Jump to content](#bodyContent)

[![Extended-protected article](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8c/Extended-protection-shackle.svg/20px-Extended-protection-shackle.svg.png)](/wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy#extended "This article is extended-confirmed-protected")

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Vice President of the United States since 2025

| JD Vance |     |
| --- | --- |
| [![Official portrait of JD Vance, a middle-aged white man with dark hair and beard and light eyes, wearing a suit and tie, crossing his arms while standing in front of an American flag.](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/VancePortrait.jpg/250px-VancePortrait.jpg)](/wiki/File:VancePortrait.jpg)<br><br>Official portrait, 2025 |     |
|     |     |
| 50th [Vice President of the United States](/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States "Vice President of the United States") |     |
| **[Incumbent](/wiki/Incumbent "Incumbent")<br>** |     |
| **Assumed office**  <br>January 20, 2025 |     |
| President | [Donald Trump](/wiki/Donald_Trump "Donald Trump") |
| Preceded by | [Kamala Harris](/wiki/Kamala_Harris "Kamala Harris") |
| Finance Chair of the [Republican National Committee](/wiki/Republican_National_Committee "Republican National Committee") |     |
| **[Incumbent](/wiki/Incumbent "Incumbent")<br>** |     |
| **Assumed office**  <br>March 18, 2025 |     |
| Preceded by | [Duke Buchan](/wiki/Duke_Buchan "Duke Buchan") |
| [United States Senator](/wiki/United_States_Senate "United States Senate")<br>  <br>from [Ohio](/wiki/List_of_United_States_senators_from_Ohio "List of United States senators from Ohio") |     |
| **In office**  <br>January 3, 2023 – January 10, 2025 |     |
| Preceded by | [Rob Portman](/wiki/Rob_Portman "Rob Portman") |
| Succeeded by | [Jon Husted](/wiki/Jon_Husted "Jon Husted") |
|     |     |
| Personal details |     |
| Born | James Donald Bowman[\[a\]](#cite_note-name_change-1)<br><br>  <br>(1984-08-02) August 2, 1984 (age 40)  <br>[Middletown, Ohio](/wiki/Middletown,_Ohio "Middletown, Ohio")<br>, U.S. |
| Political party | [Republican](/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States) "Republican Party (United States)") |
| Spouse | [Usha Chilukuri](/wiki/Usha_Vance "Usha Vance")<br><br>​<br><br>(m. 2014)​ |
| Children | 3   |
| Relatives | [Nate Vance](/wiki/Nate_Vance "Nate Vance")<br> (cousin) |
| Residence | [Number One Observatory Circle](/wiki/Number_One_Observatory_Circle "Number One Observatory Circle") |
| Education | *   [Ohio State University](/wiki/Ohio_State_University "Ohio State University")<br>     ([BA](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts "Bachelor of Arts")<br>    )<br>*   [Yale University](/wiki/Yale_University "Yale University")<br>     ([JD](/wiki/Juris_Doctor "Juris Doctor")<br>    ) |
| Signature | [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/JD_Vance_Signature-01.svg/250px-JD_Vance_Signature-01.svg.png)](/wiki/File:JD_Vance_Signature-01.svg "JD Vance's signature") |
| Military service |     |
| Branch/service | [United States Marine Corps](/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps "United States Marine Corps") |
| Years of service | 2003–2007 |
| Rank | [Corporal](/wiki/Corporal_(United_States) "Corporal (United States)") |
| Unit | [2nd Marine Aircraft Wing](/wiki/2nd_Marine_Aircraft_Wing "2nd Marine Aircraft Wing") |
| Battles/wars | [Iraq War](/wiki/Iraq_War "Iraq War") |
| Awards | *   [Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal](/wiki/Achievement_Medal "Achievement Medal")<br>    <br>*   [Marine Corps Good Conduct Medal](/wiki/Good_Conduct_Medal_(United_States) "Good Conduct Medal (United States)") |
| **Writing career** |     |
| Genre | [Memoir](/wiki/Memoir "Memoir") |
| Notable works | _[Hillbilly Elegy](/wiki/Hillbilly_Elegy "Hillbilly Elegy")<br>_ |
|     |     |
| [Vance's voice](/wiki/File:JD_Vance_on_the_United_States_Foreign_Policy.ogg "File:JD Vance on the United States Foreign Policy.ogg")<br><br>Vance discusses [United States foreign policy](/wiki/United_States_foreign_policy "United States foreign policy")<br>. [His political positions](/wiki/Political_positions_of_JD_Vance "Political positions of JD Vance")
 include opposition to [abortion](/wiki/Abortion_in_the_United_States "Abortion in the United States")
, [same-sex marriage](/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_the_United_States "Same-sex marriage in the United States")
, and [gun control](/wiki/Gun_control "Gun control")
. His surname changed to hers after her parents became his caretakers.[\[10\]](#cite_note-PeopleParents-11)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVance201694-12)
[\[12\]](#cite_note-13)

Vance has written that his childhood was marked by poverty and abuse, and that his mother struggled with [drug addiction](/wiki/Drug_addiction "Drug addiction")
.[\[13\]](#cite_note-14)
 He and his elder sister, Lindsey, were raised primarily by their maternal grandparents, James and Bonnie Vance (née Blanton), whom they called "Papaw" and "Mamaw".[\[14\]](#cite_note-npr7/18-15)
[\[10\]](#cite_note-PeopleParents-11)

After graduating from [Middletown High School](/wiki/Middletown_High_School_(Ohio) "Middletown High School (Ohio)")
 in 2003, Vance enlisted in the [United States Marine Corps](/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps "United States Marine Corps")
,[\[15\]](#cite_note-Herb-2024-16)
 serving as a [military journalist](/wiki/Military_journalism_in_the_United_States "Military journalism in the United States")
 with the [2nd Marine Aircraft Wing](/wiki/2nd_Marine_Aircraft_Wing "2nd Marine Aircraft Wing")
.[\[16\]](#cite_note-17)
 During his four years of service, he was deployed to the [Iraq War](/wiki/Iraq_War "Iraq War")
 in 2005 for six months in a non-combat role, writing articles and taking photographs.[\[15\]](#cite_note-Herb-2024-16)
 He attained the rank of [corporal](/wiki/Corporal#United_States "Corporal")
, and his decorations included the [Marine Corps Good Conduct Medal](/wiki/Marine_Corps_Good_Conduct_Medal "Marine Corps Good Conduct Medal")
 and the [Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal](/wiki/Navy_and_Marine_Corps_Achievement_Medal "Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal")
.[\[17\]](#cite_note-Medals-18)

In 2007, Vance left the military and used the [G.I. Hamel.[\[25\]](#cite_note-26)
[\[26\]](#cite_note-27)
 Although _Hillbilly Elegy_ states that he adopted his grandparents' surname of Vance upon his marriage in 2014,[\[8\]](#cite_note-he-9)
[\[27\]](#cite_note-FOOTNOTEVance2016339-28)
 the name change actually occurred in April 2013, as he was about to graduate from Yale.[\[1\]](#cite_note-smyth-2)
[\[23\]](#cite_note-Saul-2024-24)
 Vance obtained his [Juris Doctor](/wiki/Juris_Doctor "Juris Doctor")
 (JD) degree from Yale Law School in May 2013.[\[28\]](#cite_note-Haney-29)

Early career
------------

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/J.D._Vance_-_U.S._Marine_Corps_Portrait.png/250px-J.D._Vance_-_U.S._Marine_Corps_Portrait.png)](/wiki/File:J.D._Vance_-_U.S._Marine_Corps_Portrait.png)

Vance (then Hamel) in the [U.S. The _Times_ listed it among "6 Books to Help Understand Trump's Win",[\[35\]](#cite_note-6_Books2-36)
 and Vance was profiled in _[The Washington Post](/wiki/The_Washington_Post "The Washington Post")
_, which called him "the voice of the [Rust Belt](/wiki/Rust_Belt "Rust Belt")
".[\[36\]](#cite_note-Washington_Post_2017-02-06-37)
 In _[The New Republic](/wiki/The_New_Republic "The New Republic")
_, Sarah Jones criticized Vance as "liberal media's favorite [white trash](/wiki/White_trash "White trash")
–splainer" and a "false prophet of [blue America](/wiki/Blue_America "Blue America")
", calling the book "little more than a list of myths about [welfare queens](/wiki/Welfare_queen "Welfare queen")
".[\[37\]](#cite_note-38)
 _Hillbilly Elegy_'s success helped propel Vance into contact with social elites, and he began writing a column for _The New York Times_. Vance later said that his interactions with social elites from this time, particularly their perceived disdain for "the people he grew up with", helped shape his later views.[\[38\]](#cite_note-39)

In 2017, Vance joined [Revolution LLC](/wiki/Revolution_LLC "Revolution LLC")
,[\[39\]](#cite_note-Heater-2017-40)
 an investment firm founded by [Steve Case](/wiki/Steve_Case "Steve Case")
.[\[39\]](#cite_note-Heater-2017-40)
 Vance was tasked with expanding the "Rise of the Rest" initiative, which focuses on growing investments in underserved regions outside [Silicon Valley](/wiki/Silicon_Valley "Silicon Valley")
 and New York City.[\[39\]](#cite_note-Heater-2017-40)

Vance was a [CNN](/wiki/CNN "CNN")
 contributor in 2017 and 2018.[\[40\]](#cite_note-41)
 In April 2017, [Ron Howard](/wiki/Ron_Howard "Ron Howard")
 signed on to direct [the film version](/wiki/Hillbilly_Elegy_(film) "Hillbilly Elegy (film)")
 of _Hillbilly Elegy_, which was released in select theaters on November 11, 2020. It was released on [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
 for streaming.[\[41\]](#cite_note-42)

In 2019, Vance served on the board of advisors of the [With Honor Fund](/wiki/With_Honor_Fund "With Honor Fund")
, a [Super PAC](/wiki/Political_action_committee#Super_PACs "Political action committee")
 that helps veterans run for office.[\[42\]](#cite_note-43)
 From 2020 to 2023, he served on the board of advisors of American Moment, a networking and training organization for young conservatives that is affiliated with [Project 2025](/wiki/Project_2025 "Project 2025")
.[\[43\]](#cite_note-44)
[\[44\]](#cite_note-45)

In 2019, Vance and [Chris Buskirk](/wiki/Chris_Buskirk "Chris Buskirk")
 co-founded the conservative political advocacy group [Rockbridge Network](/wiki/Rockbridge_Network "Rockbridge Network")
.[\[45\]](#cite_note-46)
 That year, he also co-founded venture capital firm Narya Capital in Cincinnati with financial backing from Thiel, [Eric Schmidt](/wiki/Eric_Schmidt "Eric Schmidt")
, and [Marc Andreessen](/wiki/Marc_Andreessen "Marc Andreessen")
.[\[46\]](#cite_note-47)
 During 2020, he raised $93 million for the firm.[\[47\]](#cite_note-48)
 With [Peter Thiel](/wiki/Peter_Thiel "Peter Thiel")
 and former Trump adviser Darren Blanton, Vance invested in [Rumble](/wiki/Rumble_(website) "Rumble (website)")
, a Canadian [online video platform](/wiki/Online_video_platform "Online video platform")
 popular with the political right.[\[48\]](#cite_note-49)
[\[49\]](#cite_note-Lutz-2021-50)

### Our Ohio Renewal

In December 2016, Vance said he planned to move to Ohio and would consider starting a nonprofit or running for office.[\[50\]](#cite_note-51)
[\[36\]](#cite_note-Washington_Post_2017-02-06-37)
 In Ohio, he started Our Ohio Renewal, a [501(c)(4)](/wiki/501(c)_organization#501(c)(4) "501(c) organization")
 advocacy organization focused on education, addiction, and other "social ills" he had mentioned in his memoir.[\[51\]](#cite_note-Fowler-2024-52)
 According to a 2017 archived capture of the nonprofit's website, the advisory board members were [Keith Humphreys](/wiki/Keith_Humphreys "Keith Humphreys")
, [Jamil Jivani](/wiki/Jamil_Jivani "Jamil Jivani")
, [Yuval Levin](/wiki/Yuval_Levin "Yuval Levin")
, and [Sally Satel](/wiki/Sally_Satel "Sally Satel")
.[\[52\]](#cite_note-53)
[\[53\]](#cite_note-h036-54)
 According to a 2020 capture of the website, those four remained in those positions throughout the organization's existence.[\[54\]](#cite_note-55)
 Our Ohio Renewal closed by 2021 with sparse achievements.[\[51\]](#cite_note-Fowler-2024-52)
[\[55\]](#cite_note-56)
 According to Jivani, the organization's director of law and policy, its work was derailed by Jivani's [cancer diagnosis](/wiki/Lymphoma "Lymphoma")
.[\[56\]](#cite_note-Jivani-57)
[\[57\]](#cite_note-58)
 It raised around $221,000 in 2017 (including $80,000 from Vance himself) and spent most of its revenue on [overhead costs](/wiki/Overhead_costs "Overhead costs")
 and travel. In subsequent years, it raised less than $50,000.[\[53\]](#cite_note-h036-54)
[\[58\]](#cite_note-y409-59)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Small_Talks_DC-_Securing_the_American_Dream_for_Young_Children_%2837629711710%29_%28a%29.jpg/250px-Small_Talks_DC-_Securing_the_American_Dream_for_Young_Children_%2837629711710%29_%28a%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Small_Talks_DC-_Securing_the_American_Dream_for_Young_Children_(37629711710)_(a).jpg)

Vance speaks about his book _[Hillbilly Elegy](/wiki/Hillbilly_Elegy "Hillbilly Elegy")
_ at [New America](/wiki/New_America_(organization) "New America (organization)")
's _Securing the American Dream for Young Children_ event, 2017.

During Vance's 2022 U.S."

# Your Summary

The Wikipedia page on J.D. Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps from 2003-2007, including deployment to the Iraq War in 2005. It also mentions his book "Hillbilly Elegy". The page also includes a signature of J.D. Vance.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html):

Currently, if you search for JD Vance's profile on Bluesky, you can see a message pop up, saying: “Account has been suspended.” Earlier in the day, the 40-year-old posted about joining the application.

JD Vance suspended from Bluesky 20 minutes after joining X rival? Here's the truth
==================================================================================

By[Yash Nitish Bajaj](/author/yash-nitish-bajaj-101742533028795)

Updated on: Jun 19, 2025 04:17 am IST

[](javascript:void(0); "bookmark")
[](javascript:void(0) "what's app")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Facebook")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Twitter")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Linkdin")

Share Via

[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)

Copy Link

JD Vance on Wednesday posted about joining prime X rival, Bluesky. However, he was soon suspended
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

JD Vance on Wednesday posted about joining prime X rival, [Bluesky](https://www.hindustantimes.com/business/bluesky-ceo-says-tshirt-she-trolled-mark-zuckerberg-with-got-sold-out-in-30-mins-101742032664919.html)
. Insta suspended JD Vance,” a third person wrote. 

What is Bluesky?
----------------

Bluesky is a social media platform, operating on the AT Protocol, that aims to give users more control over their data and experience. It's designed to be open, transparent, and customizable, with features similar to Twitter, like microblogging, but with a focus on user choice and control.

![](https://www.hindustantimes.com/static-content/1y/ht/1x1.webp)

*   [Jd Vance](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/jd-vance)
    
*   [Social Media](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/social-media)
    

Stay updated with [US News](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news)
 covering politics, crime, weather, local events, and sports highlights. He argues that many of our so-called "experts" have used bad arguments and substandard science to push experimental therapies on our youth," he added in another message. 

Read More: [Whom did Vance Boelter vote for? What do you think?” the VP asked. 

Reactions to JD Vance's Bluesky suspension
------------------------------------------

Reacting to Vance's suspension, one social media user wrote: "Blue sky already suspended JD Vance. His account lasted less than 15 minutes.

“JD Vance was immediately banned after joining Bluesky,” a second person tweeted. 

“What is going on over at Bluesky?"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform. <image:19> The article mentions that Vance posted about joining Bluesky and that his account was suspended soon after.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance): 
Content: The Wikipedia page on J.D. Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps from 2003-2007, including deployment to the Iraq War in 2005. It also mentions his book "Hillbilly Elegy". The page also includes a signature of J.D. Vance.


From [Source](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html): 
Content: The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform. <image:19> The article mentions that Vance posted about joining Bluesky and that his account was suspended soon after.


From [Source](https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html): 
Content: The search result from Yahoo News includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X (formerly Twitter) post. <image:1058>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia page on J.D. Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps and his book "Hillbilly Elegy" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance)). The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform <image:19> ([https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html)).

Yahoo News includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X post <image:1058> ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html)).

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```

```

## Evidence

Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps and his book "Hillbilly Elegy" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance)). The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform <image:19> ([https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html)).

# Your Analysis

Vance's Bluesky account, and Yahoo News includes a screenshot of an X post by J.D. Vance. The provided evidence supports the claim that the image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia page on J.D. Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps and his book "Hillbilly Elegy" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance)). The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform <image:19> ([https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html)).

Yahoo News includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X post <image:1058> ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html)).


## Elaboration
The evidence includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile, which shows the profile saying "I stand with Israel." The Hindustan Times article mentions J.D. Vance's Bluesky account, and Yahoo News includes a screenshot of an X post by J.D. Vance. The provided evidence supports the claim that the image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile, which shows the profile saying "I stand with Israel." The Hindustan Times article mentions J.D. Vance's Bluesky account, and Yahoo News includes a screenshot of an X post by J.D. Vance. The provided evidence supports the claim that the image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile.

The claim is supported by the provided evidence, which includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile. Therefore, the claim is factually accurate. `true`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:19> This image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile that says 'I stand with Israel'."

## Actions
```
web_search("J.D. Vance X profile")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia page on J.D. Vance includes a portrait of him <image:1> and mentions his service in the United States Marine Corps and his book "Hillbilly Elegy" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JD_Vance)). The Hindustan Times reports that J.D. Vance's Bluesky account was suspended shortly after he joined the platform <image:19> ([https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-suspended-from-bluesky-20-minutes-after-joining-x-rival-heres-the-truth-101750285757397.html)).

Yahoo News includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X post <image:1058> ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/jd-vance-just-tweeted-then-203148806.html)).


## Elaboration
The evidence includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile, which shows the profile saying "I stand with Israel." The Hindustan Times article mentions J.D. Vance's Bluesky account, and Yahoo News includes a screenshot of an X post by J.D. Vance. The provided evidence supports the claim that the image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile.


## Final Judgement
The evidence includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile, which shows the profile saying "I stand with Israel." The Hindustan Times article mentions J.D. Vance's Bluesky account, and Yahoo News includes a screenshot of an X post by J.D. Vance. The provided evidence supports the claim that the image is an authentic screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile.

The claim is supported by the provided evidence, which includes a screenshot of J.D. Vance's X profile. Therefore, the claim is factually accurate. `true`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

Content: "Israeli Ambassador Removed from African Union Meeting
=====================================================

*   April, 07, 2025 - 16:01

*   [](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Israeli+Ambassador+Removed+from+African+Union+Meeting+-+World+news+-+Tasnim+News+Agency https://tn.ai/3286985 "twitter")

[!Israeli Ambassador Removed from African Union Meeting <image:8418>](/en/news/2025/04/07/3286985/israeli-ambassador-removed-from-african-union-meeting)

### TEHRAN (Tasnim) – The Israeli ambassador to Ethiopia was removed from an African Union session on the Rwandan genocide after several African countries objected to his presence, reviving diplomatic tensions over Israel’s observer status.

[\- World news -](/en/service/1194/world)

Avraham Neguise was expelled from Mandela Hall at the African Union headquarters on Monday.

The removal occurred during an annual session focused on the Rwandan genocide.

According to Al Jazeera, the ambassador's participation was not anticipated, and several African delegations objected to his presence.

Diplomatic sources said the meeting was paused until Neguise left the room.

The African Union has reportedly launched an investigation to determine who authorized the Israeli ambassador's attendance.

Since the formation of the African Union in 2002, 87 non-African countries have been granted observer status, which allows them to attend meetings and engage in discussions without voting rights.

The first organization to be granted observer status was the Palestine Liberation Organization in 1973, which continues to receive broad support from African member states.

Israel gained observer status in 2021 in an effort to counter Palestinian influence within the bloc.

However, its status was later rescinded following objections from several African countries, which argued that Israel had violated the AU Charter due to its ongoing occupation of Palestinian territories.

This marks the second time an Israeli diplomat has been ejected from an AU meeting.

In February 2023, an Israeli delegation was removed from the opening ceremony of the AU summit in Addis Ababa.

The Israeli foreign ministry blamed South Africa and Algeria for what it described as a severe diplomatic breach.

According to the Israeli news site Walla, security personnel escorted the Israeli delegates out during the event.

AU member states have consistently opposed Israel’s participation, citing the ongoing war in Gaza and the genocide against the Palestinian people.

Although Israel regained observer status in 2021, Algerian diplomats moved to revoke it in January 2022.

Content: "Abushamala  | 07.04.2025 - Update : 07.04.2025

![Israeli ambassador to Ethiopia expelled from Rwanda genocide conference](https://cdnuploads.aa.com.tr/uploads/Contents/2025/04/07/thumbs_b_c_e70d963742c542fcdf0e8966820f8da0.jpg?v=222627)

[](mailto:?subject=Israeli+ambassador+to+Ethiopia+expelled+from+Rwanda+genocide+conference&body=Israeli+ambassador+to+Ethiopia+expelled+from+Rwanda+genocide+conference http://v.aa.com.tr/3530926)
[](#!)

**JERUSALEM / ISTANBUL** 

Israel’s ambassador to Ethiopia Avraham Neguise was expelled on Monday from a conference on the Rwandan genocide organized by the African Union in the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa.

A Foreign Ministry statement said that Neguise was thrown out after member states refused to participate alongside him in the conference.

The ministry also condemned statements made by Mahmoud Youssouf, Chairperson of the African Union Commission, during the event.

“It is outrageous that at an event commemorating the victims of the Tutsi genocide in Rwanda, to which the Israeli ambassador in Addis Ababa was invited, \[Youssouf\] chose to introduce anti-Israel political elements,” it said.

In July 2021, Israel said that it had rejoined the African Union as an observer member.

Neguise, a former lawmaker for the ruling Likud Party, has been Israel’s ambassador to Ethiopia since August 2024.

In February 2023, an Israeli diplomat was expelled from the 36th African Union summit of heads of state held in Addis Ababa.

The incident came as the Israeli army renewed a deadly assault on Gaza on March 18 and has since killed more than 1,400 people, injured over 3,400 others, and shattered a January ceasefire and prisoner exchange agreement in the enclave.

Over 50,700 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza in a brutal Israeli onslaught since October 2023, most of them women and children.

The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants last November for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant for war crimes and crimes against humanity in Gaza.

Israel also faces a genocide case at the International Court of Justice for its war on the enclave.

[Anadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form. **Please contact us for subscription options.**](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/p/subscription/1001)
